message.content:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: try {
    InputStream inStream = p.getInputStream();
    byte[] buffer = new byte[1024];
    int bytesRead = inStream.read(buffer);
    String inputLine = new String(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
    System.out.println(inputLine);
} catch (IOException e) {
    System.out.println(e.getMessage());
}
<<<explanation>>>: To read from the port, you can use the InputStream returned by p.getInputStream(). You can create a byte array buffer to read the data into, and then use the read() method to read bytes from the input stream into the buffer. You can then convert the bytes to a String and print it out. Make sure to handle any IOException that may occur.
